result.execSummary:
All charges against Kimberly Ann Pitman in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kimberly Ann Pitman is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly Ann Pitman

Kimberly Ann Pitman, defendant appeared in Court in person without counsel.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Court reviews status of DEs representation.    Defendant referred to apply with Judge's office for Court Appointed Attorney.
Court ruling - denies DEs motion to suppress.

Kimberly Ann Pitman, defendant appeared in Court in person without counsel.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Court addresses Atty August's motion to withdraw and notes a letter filed from Affordable Legal Services.
DE addresses the court.  Court calls Affordable Legal Services and speaks with Lacy, a paralegal in the office.  christopher@affordablelegalwi.com   Angela Bakke is the managing attorney with the firm, but does not handle criminal law.
DA Luhman - addresses fax 5-25-16 cc: DA Luhman.  COCC finds 2 page motion to withdraw scanned as pg 19-20 of the brief on May 26, 2016.
Court indicates the outstanding bill for the transcript is still the obligation of the law firm retained by the DE, Pitman and the court will communicate with the law firm directly.  Court will not be signed the Order to Withdraw at this time and will contact the law firm also in that regard.  Court instructs the DE to file a copy of the retainer agreement with the clerk.  Court instructs DE to have new counsel retained to be present at the oral ruling, with new counsel to contact the DA office.  Court orders DA office to provide a copy of the brief filed May 26, 2016.

Motion hearing 4-27-2016
Exhibits 1-3   Marked, identified, by the Court.

Kimberly Ann Pitman, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Christopher Patrick August.
Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney.
Deputy Andrew Kulas,   Sworn on oath & testifies under direct by DA GLL.  Exhibit 1   Marked, identified, by the Court.  Court addresses gallery re: cell phone restrictions in the court room and requests cell phones be set aside.  Witness identifies defendant, Kimberly Pitman.  Cross by Atty August.  Exhibit 2   misMarked as Exh 1 by the Court and identified as Exh 1 by the Atty August.   DVD of traffic stop 5/23/15 published from DA station beginning 02:29:02.  Drug dog dispatch request at 02:30:32.  Confirmation of request at 02:30:34.  Deputy approaches vehicle 02:30:52.  Confirmed driver of vehicle identity 02:31:11.  Converses with all vehicle occupants 02:31:38.  Occupants question deputy as to questions  02:31:50.  Deputy returns to squad after obtaining operator DL/contact 02:32:51.  Deputy in squad 02:33:04.  Keyboard inquiry by deputy 02:33:35.  Status of info inquiry completed by deputy 02:35:11.  Deputy received error message when entering citation through TRACS.  Exhibit 3    Marked, identified, by the Court.  Dispatch notified re: written warning and follow up re: other vehicle occupants 02:35:24.  Atty wants to advance DVD.  Obj by DA.  Court plays through DVD.  Deputy writes warning (Exh 3) 02:36:13.  Sgt Maresch arrives on scene 02:38:58.  Conversation w/ Sgt Maresch ends 02:39:36.  Sgt Maresch speaks with occupants of vehicle with Deputy Kulas in squad 02:40:01.  Sgt M returns to squad 02:40:09.  Sgt M appears with drug dog 02:40:42.  Canine alert with praise by Sgt Maresch 02:41:05.  DVD play stopped.  Cross continues from DE counsel table.  Re-direct by DA GLL.  Ref Exh 3.  Break at 9:50 a.m.
Case reconvenes 9:58.  (clerk corrected identification of Exh #2 on the court record).  Witness, Deputy Kulas excused.
Officer Dan Maresch   Sworn on oath & testifies under direct by DA GLL.  Cross by Atty August.  Witness excused.
Deputy Dani Jackson   Sworn on oath & testifies.  Witness identifies defendant.  Cross by Atty August.  Witness excused.  State moves Exh 1-3 Offered, received, by the Court.  State rests.  Defense rests.
Defense to file brief by May 25, 2016.  State response by June 10, 2016.  Oral ruling scheduled.
